context: The word 'otsivad' is the 3rd person plural present tense form of the Estonian verb 'otsima', which means 'to look for' or 'to seek'. It is used when referring to a group of people (they) who are currently in the process of searching for something. In the provided dictionary example, it appears in the phrase 'Mis ilmaimet nad siit otsivad!' which translates to 'What rare wonders are they looking for here!'
